text:
HI friends, I am back with a new lesson. Well!
has any one ever asked you how old are you?

Well a lot of people ask me and I do tell
them, I am 16 years old with 10 years of experience.

Well I am just joking. So, today's lesson
is about Age, how do you tell your age or

how do you ask someone's age. Now you need
to be a little careful when you ask someone's

age because some people may get a little offended,
okay. So do it very politely and courteously.

The common way of asking is - How old are
you? Or if you want to ask about ... say your

friend's sister, you could say - How old is
your sister? So we have different ways of

saying or talking about age. The first one
is - My sister is 25 years old. Now a lot

of people say - My sister is 25 years. So
if you say - My sister is 25 years. It's absolutely

incorrect, 25 years... what? so you say - My
sister is 25 years old, don't get intimidated

by this word old, don't worry 25 years is
still very young. So my sister is 25 years

old OR you can say - My sister is 25 years
of age. Now when you say - I am 30 years of

age. It means it's is a more formal way of
talking about age. So you have two ways, either

you say - My sister is 25 years old... 25
years old.. do not say 25 years this is absolutely

incorrect.. you say 25 years old OR if you
want to be more formal 0 25 years of age.

Now a lot of people say - My sister is 25.
That is absolutely okay, but don't say 25

years. So you have three options - My sister
is 25. My sister is 25 years old. Or to be

more formal you say - My sister is 25 years
of age.Okay so got that one. So this is how

you talk about age. You can say - I am 30
years old , I am 20 years old. Now My friend

gas two sons aged .. see how it is used...
aged 8 and 1. My friend has - she possess

two sons .. she has two kids aged ... now
this is how old they are 8 and 10. So when

you use aged you do not use years , so here
you do not use years. You say - My friend

has two sons aged 8 and 10. My Uncle has a
beautiful daughter aged 20, that means she

is 20 years old. So this is alike an adjective
- aged 8 and 10.Well it's a little weird,

you don't say I am aged 20, you will always
talk about someone having kids and their age,

so you say - My friend has two sons aged 8
and 10. Like I said - My Uncle has this beautiful

daughter aged 20. This is how you used aged
to talk about how old someone is. Maria has

a 4 year old kid. Now if you go to see, I
have used 'a' here - Maria has a 4 year old

kid. A lot people make this mistake by saying
- Maria has a 4 years old kid. You do not

say '4 years' because it's 'a 4 year' old
kid. I have a 10 year old cousin who is really

cute. So I am not gonna say - I have a 10
years old, no you do not say 'years' when

you have 'a' , you say I have a 10 year old
cousin who is very cute, okay or who is really

cute. So you can say it 'a' , 'number' and
year old. Well my friend delivered a baby,

so she has a 3 month old baby. A 3 month old
baby. So now just because it's 3 month, you

do not put 's', don't make this mistake, very
common mistake - it's a 3 month old baby.

So these are the ways you can talk about age
in general, and of course this is pertaining

to people. Now let's take a look at things,
when you want to talk about how old things

are. So if I say - My house is 20 years old.
So I have 20 years old. My cousins apartment

is 10 years old. So you have 'years old'.
This is for things, alright! Another way to

say - My 10 year old car still runs smoothly.
So 'my ten year old car' still runs smoothly.

Here you do not say - 'My 10 years old car'
So well for me My 8 year old mobile phone

still functions really well. it doesn't hang.
So yes my 8 year old phone functions really

well. So this is how you talk about things
, either you say - My house is 20 years old.

Or you say - My 10 year old car or My 8 year
old mobile works really well. Now this is

how we talk about definite age, like I mentioned
20 years old, 10 year old. For people I mentioned

the exact age - 25 years, aged 8 & 10. But
well sometimes we do not know the exact age

and you just may not want to reveal your real
age. So you may want to give people a rough

idea about your age . So we are gonna take
a look at what words we could use where you

give people an idea, but you hide your real
age.

So sometimes when you guess someone's age
or when you talk about someone's age you could

say - He is in his early thirties, that means
- 31, 32 maybe 33. If you say mid thirties

that means somewhere around 35 to 37 and late
thirties means obviously after, I mean plus

37 to 40. So if he is in his early thirties
- 31 to maybe 33, alright. So when you guess

someone's age or when you don't want to reveal
your real age you could say - I am in my early

twenties. Now, She is in her teens. Now hen
you say - teens, we talk about teenagers.

Teenagers mean 13 , okay this is because where
the teen starts 11, 12, 13 to say 13, 14.

15 16 , 17, 18 and 19, till 19 you are in
your teens. So anywhere between 13 to 19,

then you are lucky because you are in your
teens and that's the best age to be in. Well

she is in her teens, most college students
are in their teens, lucky them. Most students

in my class are above or below the age of
twenty. Now above twenty means 20 plus years

old, below means less than 20. So when you
generally speak you say - people in this auditorium

are above the age of 30 or below the age of
40. So above means plus and below 40 means

less than 40. So this a another way you express
approximate or tentative age. Now Maria is

nearly or almost 40. She is not 40 yet, almost.
Thant means - you could say - it could be

her late thirties, so she could be maybe 38,
39 So you just guess.. she is almost .. not

far from 40. Now another way to say is - John
is above 50. Now he could be 50, he could

be somewhere around 49 , 51, 52 but around
50, so about 50 or you could also say around

50 years old. So sometimes when you talk with
your friends and guess someone's age so you

always make these... use these words .. you
say , I am not sure he must be about 30, right?

or maybe in his mid thirties , okay so this
is how we use these words to talk about approximate

age of people. he must be under 18. Now here
must doesn't mean he has to be or it's an

obligation or a compulsion. It only means
you are assuming, he must be under 18 means

less than 18. So he must be , here you are
assuming , it's an assumption. He must be

under 18, alright? So friends this is how
we use different words to talk about tentative

age and when you really don't know the age,
sometimes you don't want to reveal your real

age these are the words you could use, early,
late, above, nearly, almost, above , below,

okay.. to give people a rough idea about your
age. Well this brings me to end of this lesson,

I hope you enjoyed watching it so go out and
